title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.2: LEARNING OUTCOMES AND SKILLS DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: Output 2.4 Every Child learns: LAC COs have increased capacity to develop, implement and deliver results for every child to access Early Child Development (ECD) and education opportunities and learn, including in emergencies, fragile and humanitarian contexts., which contributes to Learning Outcomes, Maternal And Newborn Health, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 2 EVERY CHILD LEARNS : Girls and boys and adolescents in LAC benefit from equitable, inclusive and relevant Early Child Development (ECD) and education programmes and policies, fostering their full development in the early years, on-time enrollment, transitions, and completion as well as their learning and skills development.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.4 Every Child learns: LAC COs have increased capacity to develop, implement and deliver results for every child toaccess ECD and education opportunities and learn, including in emergencies, fragile and humanitarian contexts.

description.narrative: ERCE 2019 results were launched in 2021 together with UNESCO, providing a snapshot of proficiency levels of primary-education students in literacy, numeracy and in transferable skills such as empathy, respect for diversity and self-management. Regional discussions on assessing learning losses due to the pandemic and on planning remedial learning programmes and strategies were promoted, as a mean to support the preparation for school reopening in early 2022. Skills development was promoted across LAC, trough the dissemination of the regional adaptation of the Global Framework on Skills in English/Spanish, as well as with de English version of “Plan 12”. | Status:Met | As-of Date:28/02/2022

title.narrative: Number of countries participating in regional standardized learning assessments which benefit form updated data and policy recommendations on improving learning outcomes(69207)
